paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 is involved in DNA damage repair and is a tumor suppressor.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, variants co-segregate with breast cancer in families.
variants.additional_notes: BRCA2 variants account for a significant portion of familial breast cancer risk.
key_quotes: Female carriers of BRCA1 or BRCA2 pathogenic variants have an ~70% lifetime risk of being diagnosed with breast cancer by age 80.
A review of the BRCA Exchange database describes more than 2600 different pathogenic variants in the BRCA2 gene.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only BRCA2 variants were extracted as per instructions.
